ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
AASPIRE Participant Type / Version Administered
Notes: 1= Direct Report (DR); 2= Direct Report - Supported (DR-S); 3= Caregiver Report (CR)

ElementDescription: What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Employed for pay full time by a company, organization, or agency
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Employed for pay part time by a company, organization, or agency
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Self-employed for pay / doing paid gigs or contract work
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Paid internship
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Unpaid internship (an unpaid job to gain experience working)
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Volunteer work (an unpaid job for fun or interest)
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Student
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): On disability
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Unemployed and looking for work
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Unemployed and not looking for work
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Stay-at-home parent / homemaker
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Retired
What is (Direct Report: your / Caregiver Report: their) current employment status? (Check all that apply): Other
The next questions ask about (Direct Report: paid employment or your paid jobs / Caregiver Report: their employment or their other paid jobs). Would you like to:
Notes: 1= Try to answer them; 2= Skip these sections

ElementDescription: How many different jobs do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) work? If (you/they) are self-employed, think about all (your/their) self-employment as one job.
Notes: Number of jobs; 4= 4 or more; 5= Other

ElementDescription: All together, how many hours of paid work do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) do in a week, on average?

The next question will be about how much (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get paid, overall, for the work that (you/they) do. What would be the easiest way for you to answer that question?
Notes: 1= Hourly pay; 2= Weekly pay; 3= Two-week pay (paid every two weeks); 4= Monthly pay; 5= Yearly salary or income; 6= None of the above. Give me a blank space where I can just write what I want; 7= I do not want to answer

ElementDescription: How much do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get paid per hour?
Notes: 1= Less than $7.25 per hour; 2= Between $7.26 - $10; 3= Between $10.01 - $15; 4= Between $15.01 - $25; 5= Between $25.01 - $40; 6= Between $40.01 - $ 60; 7= Over $60 per hour

ElementDescription: How much do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get paid for work each week?
Notes: 1= Less than $290 per week; 2= Between $290.01 - $400; 3= Between $400.01 - $600; 4= Between $600.01 - $1000; 5= Between $1600.01 - $2400; 6= Between $40.01 - $ 60; 7= Over $2400 per week

ElementDescription: How much do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get paid for work every two weeks?
Notes: 1= Less than $580 every two-weeks; 2= Between $580.01 - $800; 3= Between $800.01 - $1200; 4= Between $1200.01 - $2000; 5= Between $2000.01 - $3200; 6= Between $3200.01 - $4800; 7= Over $4800 every two-weeks

ElementDescription: How much do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get paid for work each month?
How much do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) make in a year? Only include what you/they get paid for working.
How much do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get paid? Write-In

Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) depend on the money (you/they) get paid from (your/their) job to pay for most of (your/their) basic needs? For example, if (you/they) did not get paid from these jobs, (Direct Report: would you have trouble getting / Caregiver Report: they would not have) enough food to eat or (having/have) a place to live.
Notes: 0= No, e.g., (Direct Report: my / Caregiver Report: their) family or partner pays for those kinds of things, (I am/they are) on disability, (I am/they are) retired, or (I/they) get money from a special fund; 1= Yes; 2= I do not know

ElementDescription: Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get health insurance or other benefits from any of (your/their) jobs?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= I do not know

ElementDescription: What kind of work do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) do?

How often do (Direct Report: you need / Caregiver Report: you think they need) formal support services other than accommodations (work accommodations are the changes to the unusual ways of doing things that may help a person with a disability be able to do their job, e.g., having workplace expectations and instructions written in plain language, having an adjustable desk, allowing employees to work from home/remotely, providing work material in accessible ways, providing assistive technology such as a screen reader or hearing aid compatible telephone, allowing for a flexible work schedule) to work? For example: how often do (you/they) need support from a job coach, employment specialist, or an agency that provides supported employment?
Notes: 1= Always or often; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or never

ElementDescription: How often do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) get formal support services other than accommodations? For example, how often do (you/they) get support from a job coach, employment specialist, or agency that provides supported employment to be able to work?
Notes: 1= Always or often; 2= Sometimes; 3= Rarely or never

ElementDescription: Do (Direct Report: you / Caregiver Report: they) regularly get additional income or financial support from something other than (your/their) paid job(s)? Examples could include: disability income (like being on social security, workman's comp, or disability insurance); (your/their) parents or other family members paying for (your/their) rent or living expenses; (your/their) spouse or intimate partner paying more than half of your household expenses; living off retirement savings or a pension; living off money from trust funds, special needs funds, investments, or an inheritance
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes; 2= I do not know

ElementDescription: (Direct Report) Did you get any help while answering the questions in this section of the survey?
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I did not get any help

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me use a computer, smartphone, or other device (for example, they clicked on the answers I chose).
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone read the survey to me.

(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me understand what the questions or answers options meant.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone helped me decide how to answer the questions on the survey.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): I got some other type of help to answer the questions.
(Direct Report) What kind of help did you get while answering the questions in this section of the survey? (Check all that apply): Someone answered the questions for me, without my input.
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): They told me (in whatever mode they communicate)
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I have observed the action, behavior, or event
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I can interpret their behaviors and/or vocalizations
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Someone else told me
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I have known them for a long time
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): I feel like I can guess because I spend a lot of time with them
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): None of the above
(Caregiver Report) How do you know this information? (Check all that apply): Other, specify
(Caregiver Report) On a scale of 0 to 10, how confident are you about your responses?
Notes: 0= Not at all confident; 10= Totally confident

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
